events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred last night involving another vehicle at a busy intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised as an Auto Accident claim based on the description of the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to start assisting the customer with the vehicle accident claim.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured the customer of prompt support.
Request for submission of police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and witness statements was sent to the customer.
The customer submitted all requested documents including police reports and detailed photos of the vehicle damage.
The investigation team began reviewing the evidence and assessing the circumstances of the reported vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and the damage assessment was approved for repair coverage.
A settlement offer was proposed covering the full cost of vehicle repairs and rental car reimbursement during the process.
The customer responded positively, expressing gratitude for the quick and fair handling of their car accident claim.
The claim was officially approved following customer agreement with the settlement terms proposed by the insurer.
Payment covering approved vehicle repair costs was issued to the customerâ€™s designated account promptly.
The insurance claim was formally closed after all procedures were completed and the customer acknowledged resolution.
The complete file and all documents related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference compliance.
